intro: Bonamia herminieri, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Bonamia herminieri is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
